intro.text: Welcome to my portfolio. I am a self-taught front-end developer who loves building React applications. Recently, I have decided to turn this hobby of mine into a full-fledged career. I pull together a selection of my projects for you. These projects showcase my skills in React, Redux, TypeScript, web accessibility as well as solutions to various challenges these applications presented. I also welcome you to walk through my journey into web developement and get a glimpse at my future goals:

journeySteps.label: University
journeySteps.content: I graduated UofR with a Bachelor's degree in Microbiology and a minor in Arabic.
journeySteps.arabicContent: تخرجت من جامعة روشيتر بدرجة البكالوريوس في الأحياء الدقيقة وتخصصت في اللغة العربية

journeySteps.label: Teaching
journeySteps.content: Teaching English as a second language remotely has connected me to people from across the world. My interest in coding actually began after reviewing a student's dissertation on programming languages and methodology. I was so fascinated by it that I—with zero prior knowledge—decided to venture into the world of coding.

journeySteps.label: Ruby
journeySteps.content: Ruby was the first language I learned. Its English-like syntax is a great start for novices. I had a lot of fun building games in this language; however, I wanted to create applications that ran in the browser. Onward we go!

journeySteps.label: JavaScript
journeySteps.content: I gave up my beloved Ruby for JavaScript. The transition was tough at first but who can resist the language of the web? With JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, I started building and designing applications. My proudest application at the time was Memory Game.

journeySteps.label: Responsive Design
journeySteps.content: After learning the fundamentals of responsive design and design strategies such as mobile-first, I created sample pages of my own design, and clones.

journeySteps.label: React
journeySteps.content: Ah... React. Around this time, my most challenging React application was Minesweeper. Originally, I built it to focus on using Redux to manage the state but it also led me to delve deeper into data structures and algorithms. Since then I have built numerous React applications.

journeySteps.label: First Team Project
journeySteps.content: I was invited to collaborate on a project. It was an incredible experience to work alongside another developer. I was responsible for designing and implementing entire features and paired with the lead developer on several others. I also presented my ideas that I thought were meaningful to the project or that particular roll-out. This was also my first time working with Firebase.

journeySteps.label: TypeScript
journeySteps.content: I heart TypeScript! No more silly typos and passing the wrong arguments!

journeySteps.label: Future
journeySteps.content: I have gained a lot of experience building applications, and researching and learning technologies to suit my needs. However, building and designing web app as just a hobby is no longer scratching the itch. I am excited to turn front-end development into a full time career. As for my study goals, I would love to explore the back-end more and become more Full Stack.
